abstract.text: A class that implements the Quick Look preview panel to display a preview of a list of items.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: Every application has a single shared instance of
. The preview panel follows the responder chain and adapts to the first responder willing to control it. A preview panel controller provides the content through methods defined in the
; you can, however, customize its behavior using a
protocol for the methods to customize a preview panel’s behavior.

abstract.text: Create previews of files to use inside your macOS app.
A protocol that defines a set of properties you implement to make a preview of your application’s content.
A type that defines a block used to load a Quick Look preview item.
A class that implements the Quick Look preview panel to display a preview of a list of items.
The current first responder accepting to control the preview panel.
The currently previewed item.
The index of the current preview item.
The preview panel data source.
The delegate object that controls the preview panel’s behavior.
The preview panel’s display state.
Instructs the panel to enter full screen mode.
Instructs the panel to exit full screen mode.
The property that indicates whether the panel is in full screen mode.
Asks the preview panel to recompute the preview of the current preview item.
Asks the preview panel to reload its data from its data source.
Returns the shared Quick Look preview panel instance.
Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether the system has created a shared Quick Look preview panel.
Asks the preview panel to update its current controller.
A protocol that the Quick Look preview panel uses to access the contents of its data source object.
A protocol for the delegate of the Quick Look preview panel.
A Quick Look preview of an item that you can embed into your view hierarchy.
A special kind of window that typically performs a function that is auxiliary to the main window.
The complete list of properties and methods for accessible elements.
A role-based protocol that declares the minimum interface necessary to interact with an assistive app.
A set of methods that defines a way to add animation to an existing class with a minimum of API impact.
A set of methods for getting and setting the appearance attributes of a view.
A protocol that enables an object to be encoded and decoded for archiving and distribution.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
Methods that responder subclasses implement to support key binding commands, such as inserting tabs and newlines, or moving the insertion point.
A protocol that an object adopts to create a bar object in your app.
A protocol that marks classes to restore the state of your app to continue a user activity.
A set of methods used to associate a unique identifier with objects in your user interface.
A protocol that a custom class can adopt to manage the enabled state of a UI element.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A singleton actor whose executor is equivalent to the main dispatch queue.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
